page.title: 15LIFE STYLES.1920'S.BRIDGEND
page.content: Mr Richards remembers that during the 1920-1930's the fire engine was a horse and cart with a hose on the back.The milkman delivered milk from a churn using a half-pint measure and the baker sold thirteen cakes for the price of twelve.People travelled on foot,horse drawn tram or steam train. There were no televisions or videos.People watched silent movies and later talking movies.Gramophones needed to be wound up but the sound was not good.Nearly everybody went to Sunday School.The annual outing was to Ogmore by Sea,travelling in the back of a coal lorry.There they used to play games and scambled for small sweets. Mr Richards used to help drive herds of cattle along the road to the market.The valley farmers sent their cows down by train.
